subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: How Paganism Ended in Europe
description: A quick win: understand How Paganism Ended in Europe.

hook.text: It didn't go quietly. Pagans fought, hid, and blended their traditions into Christian holidays. Echoes survive today.

buildup.text: Emperor Theodosius made Christianity Rome's state religion in 380 CE. Pagan temples were systematically closed.

discovery.text: Christmas absorbed Saturnalia. Easter took spring fertility symbols. Paganism was dismantled but not entirely erased.

twist.text: The word 'pagan' means 'rural person.' Countryside folk held on longest. The last European pagans fell around 1400.

climax.text: Paganism teaches us that religions die politically, not naturally. The gods didn't lose believers; they lost power.

punchline.text: Christmas trees, Easter eggs, Halloween. Paganism hides inside Christianity.

quiz.question: How did pagan traditions survive?
options: They were absorbed into Christian holidays and customs
